page.title: 05OUR CHURCH by Peter Hope
page.content: assisted by Timothy Wright,David Carr, Melanie Todd,Tom Taylor and Nicholas Selby. We arrived at St. Laurence Church at 9.40a.m. on 13th June 1985. There we met Mr. Robert Chadwick, our guide, and the Rev.Charles Havens, the vicar. They told us that the first church was probably a primitive wooden structure in the days of Aidan, 635-651. Then we learnt about the Norman church which was a bigger and better building.How- ever it was still only a small church, which was made from stone with a wooden roof. We saw the rare and beautiful 12th century Saxon wall-paintings in the splay of two small round-headed windows. One illustration shows St. Cuthbert being anointed in his youth.
